byline.original: By MICHAEL S. SCHMIDT and DAVID E. SANGER

abstract: Russian hackers obtained access in 2014 to email archives of White House workers as well as State Dept's unclassified system that contained some of Pres Obama's email correspondence; administration officials say no classified networks were compromised and no classified information was acquired, but acknowledge that highly sensitive information could have been accessed.
lead_paragraph: The hackers did not appear to have penetrated closely guarded servers that control the message traffic from President Obama’s personal BlackBerry, officials said.

headline.main: Russian Hackers Read Obama’s Unclassified Emails, Officials Say
headline.print_headline: Russian Hackers Read Obama’s Unclassified Emails, Officials Say

snippet: The hackers did not appear to have penetrated closely guarded servers that control the message traffic from President Obama’s personal BlackBerry, officials said.
